headline.main: Smoking Among Children Is Linked To Cartoon Camel in Advertisements

keywords.value: JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN MEDICAL ASSN
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: New studies demonstrate that the cartoon camel at the center of an elaborate advertising campaign for Camel cigarettes appeals far more to children than to adults. Several researchers suggested that this and similar campaigns were such a pernicious influence on the nation's health that cigarette advertising should be totally banned. The researchers, from universities around the country, singled out the Camel cigarette campaign involving a cartoon character called Old Joe Camel. Although R. J. Reynolds, the tobacco company that produces Camels, said its advertisements were aimed at adults, the researchers said the campaign had been "far more successful at marketing Camel cigarettes to children than to adults."
